verbatim_example: I'm just happy to not be taking heroin anymore
I quit everything about a year and a half ago with the help of a detox place.
The last time I took DHC or Xanax was the Sunday of Labor Day.
I was on a large benzo/opiate habit and got off both 3 weeks to the day.
haven't had any opis in months
A week ago, I was terrified to give up the pills. ... I feel alive for the first time in 10 yrs.
Six months ago I couldn't even go 60 minutes without having to use something
Six months and some change ago I couldn't even go 60 minutes without having to use something to change the way I feel
9 months ago I was in a hospital bed, could barely walk and breathe
a year ago I was in a hospital bed...What a difference a year can make
I’m officially one year clean from opiates
Day 3 was a mixed bag. Few emotional spells, morning GI subsided, worked 9 hours, small gym session, little marijuana, fair amount of food, 5.5 hours of sleep.
Eight days down, moving into day 9
It's been a long work week, still have a full day today and tomorrow. ... I have taken care of a lot of bullshit I've been putting off for months over the last 12 days
Coming up on two weeks later today. I feel like I can remember every second that's passed by.
This past weekend was better than the last
I have never had a craving in the 17 days up until that point
Feeling better every day, looking forward to maybe sleeping in this weekend
Yesterday was okay minus a crazy afternoon episode of the sweats. I fuckin hate that feeling.
that's probably undershooting it. Tough to think about how expensive that misery really was...
This was the day of the month I would get my script refilled and normally start the process of one GREAT week followed by the cycle of withdrawal etc etc
I haven't been using for almost two months
This is the longest I've been sober in a year at least
It's been a month and a half. I feel alive. ... It's amazing how much my life has changed for the better.
it took me a year of trying but I'm going to take my 60 day chip today
I kicked a 4 year IV meth habit. I went from being a junkie to being a contributing member of society, with a great family and career.
I was able to put together a year, which turned into a year and a half (where I am currently), and now I am truly beginning to realize that there is a major difference in my thought process overall.
I was in recovery, and actually a year or so into it at that point
I've been clean for two years
I haven't touched an opiate in over two years
I finally reached a year sober literally today
I ended up throwing up over 5 times in one night
I've been sober for 13 months this coming Friday
7/18/16 was the day I actually got sober
Today i am 15 days off heroin
Today is 34 days without heroin and alcohol
Im day 39 heroin and alcohol free
I have four months clean today
now that I’m clean. Today I’ve got 90 days. 90 days ago I was sitting in the IOP program at the Betty Ford Center
So today I have 252 days clean (8 months 8 days)
I’ve been clean off of all drugs for 39 days
I’ve been clean off of all drugs for 39 days
It's been nearly two years since I stopped injecting oxy, oxymorphone, hydromorphone, morphine, and anything else really
I've been using PST, about 2-2.5 lbs of Seeds a day, depending on quality, for a little over a year. Every day, no tolerance breaks, just a few accidental withdrawals when FEDEX fucked up lol.
Tomorrow marks 1 week since my last 2lb dose of PST
So I've got about 3 weeks clean off a 2 year PST habit
5 weeks off a pretty heavy PST habit
I was being a baby and thought my body should be back to normal after just 2 mos. clean from 2 years using.
I've got about 6 months clean from an on/off whenever I could get it(percs>oxys>heroin>oxys>poppy seeds>heroin>oxy you get it) habit over last 12 years
I used to deal with by taking a handful of pills
I'm at work and don't hate being here. My body is like an old, tired sock... I keep wanting to stretch out, shake and use my muscles a bit. I'm so weak, it's been years.
I have been clean for two weeks now
Three weeks ago I was in hell. My body went through an absolute horror show of pain. Fever, shakes, nausea, muscle cramps... insomnia, jesus.
I am clean, I am alive, I am beginning to feel comfortable in my skin
my colon has finally forgiven me
Six weeks clean, feels like kind of a big deal

I went to the pharmacy today and they had just gotten a shipment of painkillers... interesting test, talking to someone about my script while a large quantity of opiates was six inches from me. I actually asked them to move the bottles.
I have two years sober today
3 years ago today would be the first day in rehab that I didn't take a suboxone and was fully off any type of narcotic
I am 8 months sober from a heavy heroin habit
I haven't touched an opiate in almost 5 months
I haven't used in around 3 weeks
these past couple days have been great

I remember myself before using and I was fun, outgoing, worked my ass off and people enjoyed being around me. Now I have messed with drugs my entire adult life, more recreationally. That was until a few years ago and one injury led me down a path that didn't take any time at all to get to the end of.
Stay clean. Shit tends to work out in the end.
I genuinely feel like I'm almost back to who I was before the opiates took over my life
I was now 7 days clean from the subs. I can honestly say compared to cold turkey this was a BREEZE.
Now I am one of those people, and you the reader with a bit of grit and hard work will be too. I could never even imagine this far and would always envy people who had 100+ days clean.
it's been about 4 months off opiates
It's been 4 days since I did any opiates and hope I can continue to stay sober
I figured it was time to stop. Lope definitely helped my withdrawals the first three days and then when I woke up on the 4th day, I felt completely fine.
been clean now from heroin, well from everything including cigarettes for 40 days
I am sober now and decided to take my dog to the lake... I would not have been outside and saw that duck if the cosmos did not align in such a way for me to stay sober now for 6 weeks and 3 days
10 months sober from a decade long stint in heroin

I got out and started working out everyday. I got really into meditation and yoga. I just wanted to be someone different, a better version of myself. I lost 40 lbs from running everyday and lifting. Fit, happy with myself.
I made a post about taking a smal shot in the middle of my wd, and I am soo glad I did cuz yea I had to start the wd all over
I've wasted so much time in my addiction
I'm close to the end of day 12 of being sober
Never want to go through Heroin withdraws ever again
I managed to get clean for a few weeks
I’ve been waking up with a lot of anxiety which sucks but it does seem to fade once I start my day and get moving.
I don't even do drugs anymore
Today is day 13 for me! This is the longest I've been sober since summer 2011
But, I am clean, and life is good!
It's day 110 for me since I last used opiates, marijuana, alcohol, coca in, etc. I've gotten out of little 90 day funk finally!
I was at my bottom and suffering relapse after relapse and again once I finally asked for help and went to rehab
Now after quitting H for almost 2 years

I've spent 95% of the money I've earned/borrowed in the past two years on these godforsaken pills, and I've only become depressed, as my fucking endorphan system doesn't work anymore, and this may take a while to heal
Hi. I'm still clean after 6 months.
I have been clean off heroin for 7 years and some change
I managed to kick a 8 ball a day habit on 9 suboxin
haven't touch heroin/opiates in a year
I got clean for close to a year
I've detoxed countless times and every time they get worse and more prolonged. I truly didn't think I would make it cold turkey.
I used to share my opiate inspired artwork
I have a little over 18 months clean
I have been opiate free for a respectable amount of time
watched it all float away like some type of beautiful mistress flying her way out of my life, but i think i'm doing good
havent used one of these in about a year
I was in hardcore, white knuckle, cold turkey withdrawal(puking, shitting, cold sweats, can't get comfortable, etc)
I have 93 days clean today!! Huge accomplishment for me, this is the longest I've been clean ever.
Was using opiates on and off for about 3 years
I’m a few days past 7 months of complete sobriety

column8: Three years ago I thought three months was impossible.

I got clean one year and two months ago
Today I have a little over nine months clean from IV heroin
I've been clean for almost a year from iv heroin
being completely sober off everything for six months
i've been clean for two months today
year one was like waking up. year two was like walking out the door
